description: Researchers analysing data from more than half a million people identify shared genetic patterns linking traits related to schizophrenia and osteoporosis

title: ‘Touched, hugged': AI staffer groped South Korean woman during frisking at B'luru airport; arrested
description: In a troubling incident at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport, a South Korean businesswoman reported being sexually harassed by a member of the airline's ground-handling team. The accused, lacking the authority to conduct proper security checks, reportedly inappropriately touched her and embraced her, all under the pretense of 'manual frisking' in a secluded area near the restrooms.

title: 'Dhurandhar' slows down ahead of 'Border 2' release
description: Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna's spy thriller 'Dhurandhar' is nearing the end of its successful theatrical run, showing a slight dip in its seventh week. Despite this, the film has maintained strong collections, reaching an impressive Rs 829.4 crore net. Facing competition, its box office journey continues as it eyes further milestones.

title: Jaipur horror: Speeding SUV kills armed forces aspirant; driver flees
description: Tragedy struck Jaipur's Express Highway as an 18-year-old preparing for armed forces recruitment was fatally struck by a speeding SUV. Anaya Sharma, a resident of Jhotwara, was waiting by the roadside for her jogging companion when the vehicle, reportedly coming from Ajmer Road, hit her with immense force.

title: Revanth-led delegation successfully convinces investors at WEF meet, explaining Telangana’s proactive policies
description: Telangana Chief Minister pitches for investments on the strength of roadmap for realising US $ 3 trillion economy

title: Surat’s water tank in Rs 21-crore project collapses before inauguration
description: Eight individuals, including two government officials, were apprehended following the catastrophic collapse of a newly constructed overhead water tank in Tadkeshwar. The arrests stem from alleged criminal breach of trust and cheating. Engineering experts are now investigating the structural failure, with police awaiting their technical report to guide further actions and potential additional arrests.

title: Electronic emergency exit doors installed at city airport
description: Airports Authority of India has changed nearly 140 emergency exit doors in the T1 and T4 domestic terminals, equipping them with electronic security and monitoring systems

title: Bengaluru chaat shop owner, aide kill estranged wife, hang body to fake suicide
description: A chaat shop owner and his employee were arrested for allegedly murdering the owner's estranged wife. The man confessed to strangling his wife with a rope and then enlisting his assistant to stage the scene as a suicide. The victim had filed for divorce, with the next hearing scheduled soon. Both accused are in police custody.

The findings can change how competitive exams like the IIT-JEE identify top-performing students, experts said

Lizelle Lee fined for Code of Conduct breach in WPL
description: "Lee admitted to a Level 1 offence under Article 2.2 of the Code of Conduct, which relates to the abuse of cricket equipment during the match. For Level 1 breaches, the match referee's decision is final and binding," a WPL release stated

title: 'Would jeopardise sanctity' - Why ICC rejects Bangladesh's venue change request
description: The ICC has rejected Bangladesh's plea to shift T20 World Cup matches from India to Sri Lanka, citing no credible security threats. Fourteen of sixteen board members voted against the relocation, emphasizing the need to maintain event integrity. Bangladesh has been given an extended deadline to confirm participation.

title: T20 World Cup: 'We needed someone…': Rohit explains Iyer's omission
description: Rohit Sharma admits watching the T20 World Cup from home will be strange. He shares insights into his captaincy, highlighting difficult selection choices. Sharma explains that balancing the team often required tough calls. He emphasizes open communication and building trust within the squad. Sharma expresses confidence in the current Indian team's stability and understanding.

description: WRD aims to complete the restoration work by the end of February; unit holders in Thirumudivakkam industrial estate say instances of waterlogging have declined in recent years

title: 108 ambulance employees put forward demands
MLB trade rumors: Phillies target $7.7mn Red Sox OF for 2026 shakeup
description: Philadelphia Phillies are reportedly eyeing Boston Red Sox outfielder Jarren Duran to bolster their struggling outfield for the 2026 season. Duran offers much-needed speed, defense, and consistent offense, fitting Philadelphia's immediate needs. A potential trade involving Alec Bohm and prospects could reshape both teams, addressing Philadelphia's outfield woes while providing Boston with key pieces.

Gracie Hunt says 'it resets my heart' amid chiefs’ disappointing season
description: The Kansas City Chiefs’ billionaire heiress, Gracie Hunt, has been a constant presence on the field as she has stayed by the team’s side through all the good and bad days. While the Kansas City Chiefs have had a pretty disappointing end in the ongoing season, the 26 year old billionaire heiress has hinted at how she has been coping with it.

title: 65 student suicides at IITs in 5 yrs, alumni group calls for accountability
description: A recent IIT-Kanpur student suicide highlights a disturbing mental health crisis across premier Indian technical institutes, with over a dozen student deaths annually for five years. Alumni and student bodies point to intense academic pressure, isolation, and exclusion as key factors.

title: 'Very productive meeting': Trump backs off on Greenland tariff threat; claims deal 'framework' in place
description: US President Donald Trump has called off planned tariffs on European allies, citing a "framework for a future deal" concerning Greenland and the Arctic.  Trump announced this on Truth Social, stating the tariffs set for February 1st would not proceed. He also previously ruled out using force to acquire the island from Denmark, demanding immediate negotiations instead.

title: 'Amitabh Bachchan wouldn't allow anyone from the industry at his home after 8pm'
description: Actor Raja Bundela lauded Amitabh Bachchan's unwavering discipline, recounting an incident where Big B ensured a Goa shoot proceeded despite forgotten continuity shoes. Bachchan personally arranged for their overnight delivery via bus and early flight, showcasing his commitment. Bundela also highlighted Bachchan's strict work-life balance, avoiding industry gossip and maintaining family time.

description: A controversial late interception call in the Buffalo Bills' playoff loss to the Denver Broncos ignited debate. While fans cried foul, NFL stars Joe Burrow and Travis Kelce defended the officials' ruling, emphasizing the strict 'process of the catch' rule.  Their support, particularly Burrow's 'flabbergasted' comment, became a talking point amidst Buffalo's familiar playoff heartbreak.

title: Protests outside UK Parliament urge Labour to act on Hindu persecution in Bangladesh
description: Protesters, including People of Indian Origin and Bangladeshi Hindus, gathered in London to urge UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer to condemn the alleged genocide of Hindus in Bangladesh. Labour MPs present acknowledged constituent concerns and pledged continued engagement with the Foreign Office to protect minorities. Organizers highlighted a significant decline in the Hindu population and called for British intervention.

title: Honour killing in Moradabad? Interfaith couple thrashed to death; girl's brother held
description: Bodies of a 24-year-old man and an 18-year-old woman from different communities, who had been missing for three days, were discovered in Moradabad district. Police suspect honour killing, with the woman's brothers arrested for allegedly killing the couple and burying their bodies near a temple.

How Sunita Williams’ 600 days in space inspired the world
description: Sunita Williams, the trailblazing Indian-American astronaut, concluded her extraordinary 27-year journey with NASA, where she spent an astonishing 600 plus days in the cosmos. Her last mission, a spontaneous 286-day residency aboard the International Space Station, not only extended her time in space but also earned her accolades for establishing new benchmarks for female spacewalks.

title: Ads in ChatGPT? Google AI CEO flags OpenAI's new experiment; terms it 'premature '
description: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis stated no plans for ads in Gemini, deeming OpenAI's ChatGPT ad test a premature revenue push. This comes amid investor concerns about OpenAI's significant spending exceeding revenue, with projections of substantial cumulative losses and unsustainable operational costs for its AI tools.

title: Donald Trump flags China, Russia threat in Greenland — how real is the danger?
Who is Cece? Twitch streamer at the center of Marvel Rivals Creator Cup controversy
description: Twitch streamer Cecee faced online backlash after a heated incident during a Marvel Rivals tournament.  She insulted a teammate during a live match.  Cecee later apologized, admitting her mistakes as team captain.  She stated she reacted emotionally and failed to de-escalate the situation.  The streamer promised to improve her leadership skills.
